text: ` ` I do not want my social media to define who I am, and I will take better care moving forward to support all walks of life,'' says Garrett Yrigoyen, a contestant on Becca Kufrin's ABC season. The contestant at the center of The Bachelorette's week - one, off - air controversy is apologizing for his ` ` hurtful and offensive'' social media history. Garrett Yrigoyen, an early frontrunner on the new cycle of Becca Kufrin's Bachelorette season on ABC, has taken to his Instagram to explain his social media behavior. Shortly after the new season launched Monday night, Yrigoyen's political beliefs and character were called into question when screengrabs of his Instagram activity were shared by another former
